feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 26 at 1:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL FLOODING OF AREA RIVERS DUE TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... Very warm and well above normal temperatures are expected to continue into mid week. These near record high temperatures will increase snow and ice melt and subsequent water-levels of area rivers including the Chilkat, Klehini, and Taiya.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 26 at 2:02PM HST until June 27 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR SOUTH FACING SHORES OF ALL ISLANDS... .A long period south swell will build through the afternoon, peak overnight, and produce advisory level surf into Monday. entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 26 at 9:52PM PDT until June 27 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Afternoon temperatures in the mid 80s to lower 90s expected Monday afternoon, hottest in valley locations. The exception will be elevations above 5000 feet, where afternoon temperatures should generally be in the 60s and 70s. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades and South Washington Cascade

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 26 at 4:16PM PDT until June 27 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Hot conditions with high temperatures in the low to mid 90s again on Monday. Overnight low temperatures tonight will likely only cool into the 60s for many locations. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Washington.
